metadata.Title: CVE-2021-37600 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** An integer overflow in util-linux through 2.37.1 canpotentially cause a buffer overflow if an attacker were able to use systemresources in a way that leads to a large number in the /proc/sysvipc/semfile. NOTE: this is unexploitable in GNU C Library environments, andpossibly in all realistic environments.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-37600` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdextrautils - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
eject - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
fdisk - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
libblkid1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
libfdisk1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
libmount1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
libsmartcols1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
libuuid1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
mount - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
rfkill - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
util-linux - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
util-linux-locales - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
uuid-runtime - 2.36.1-8ubuntu1
bsdutils - 1:2.36.1-8ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: util-linux package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.36.1-8ubuntu2').
util-linux package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.36.1-8ubuntu2').
